titleStmt.title: Citamparam, Nāṭarāja temple, time of Rājendra Cōḻa, year 24

msContents.summary: Gift of land for performing various services during festival, including adhyayana.

projectDesc.p: The project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_IdListMembers_v01.xml file.

revisionDesc.change: Creation of the file on the repository

laituṟkkaṅkaḷ Orutāṭi y-āka-k kaikkoṇ
ṭu koṇṭaviṭṭil tuṟkkattiṉ perilē I
varilē periya viṭṭu caṟuvayilakkai piṭittu

cūr mallukāṉaṉ Uttaṇṭakāṉaṉ caṉṉi

tarācu Ilakṣmipatirācu paccima vālacantiṟa mahāpā
ttiram y-ivarkaḷ mutalāṉa pāttiṟa cāmantarkaḷ
ḷai pirāṇavuṭaṉē piṭittu-k koṇṭu y-ivarkaḷu
kku Abhayastam koṭuttu taraṇikoṭṭam Amarē

ḷiṅkateca tikkuvicaiyam āka pecavāṭaikku Eḻu

kattilē piṟakarāca ciṟaccantiṟa mahāpāttira

pi Irācamayentiṟāvarattukku Eḻuntaruḷi
tēviyār ciṉṉācci Ammaṉ tirumalai tēvi Am
maṉ y-ivarkaḷum mahātānam paṇṇi vicaiya na
karattukku Eḻuntaruḷi svasti śrī vicaiyāṟputa

stikku vantaruḷi kāḷattinātaṉai c-cevittu U
ṭaiyavaṟku nūṟṟukkāl maṇṭapamum periya
kōpuramum kaṭṭivittu Aruḷi ai⌈

Uṭaiyār tiruvaṇṇāma
lai Uṭaiya nāyiṉāṟkum nācciyār Uṇṇā
mulainācciyāṟkum Irāyar kiṣṇarāyamahā
⌉rāyar taṉmamāka p-paṇṇuvitta tirup
paṇi Āyira-k-kālmaṇṭapam Itukku
muṉṉāka vasantaṉ teṟpai tirunā
ḷukku veṭṭiṉa tirukkuḷam y-itukku-t

lai tēvi Ammaṉcamuttiram patiṉoru
nilai-k kōpuram Eḻāntirunāḷ maṇ
ṭapam viṉāyakaṉukku p-paṇṇuvitta
tiruttēr tiruvīti vāṉa
vataraiyaṉ cōḻaṉ vācal katavu katavu
kāl mēṟpaṭi Uttama-cōḻaṉ tiruvā
calkāl katavu mēṟpaṭi palakaṇi-vācal
poṉpūciṉatum y-inta vācal muṉṉā
kamum pattiramāttiṟ keṭṭi koṭuṅkai

nācciyār-kōyil caṭai-perumāḷ nayi
ṉār caṉṉatikku mēṟkuvācalkāl takavu
mēṟpaṭi veṇkalamum vācalkāl ka
ta mēṟpaṭi poṉpūciṉatum tūvi po
ṉpūciṉatum nācciyār-kōyil maṭappaḷ
ḷimuṉ veṭṭiṉa Ārāvamutakkiṇaṟum ti
ruvāparaṇam kiruṣṇarāyaṉ patakkam
nākāparaṇam poṉniṟ cilai vākupuri
Uttariyam y-intiṟa vimāṉam veḷ
ḷi vintikai poṉṉiṉ cekaṇṭi ai
⌉kai Astratēva nayiṉāṟku veḷḷi-t
takaṭu muccimēl poṉpūciṉatum
tirumañcaṉam Eṭukka-p paṇṇuvi
tta veḷḷikkuṭam kiṣṇarāya mahārā
yar canti y-āka cantirātitta varaiyum
naṭakka-k kaṭṭaḷai y-iṭṭa nāḷ Oṉṟu
kku Ūṟkkālāl Arici 6-ḷ
Eṇṇai-k kāppu 2 paḻam
kaṟpūram pala 1/2 pu
ḻuku pala 1/2 tiruma
ñcaṉam Eṭupp
ār periya tirup
pāṭṭu Otuvār
pēr 2 tēvaraṭi
yār 6
Atiyyaṉam
pēr 2 palla-k
kuccervai A
tti Ayaṉa pēr
2

Hail! the illustrious mahārācāti-irāca, irācaparamēśvaran, mūvarayara-kaṇṭa the vanquisher of the three kings, ariirāyavipāṭa the destroyer of the enemy kings aṣṭatikku irāyamaṉōpayaṅkara the frightener of the mind of the kings of the eight direction, Bāṣaikkuttappuvarāyarakaṇṭa, pūruva-tekṣiṇa-paccima-camuttirāticura lord of the oceans of the east, the south and the west, Yamuṉai irācciyasthāpaṉācāriya the preceptor who established the kingdom of the Yamunā, and Kecapativipāṭa the destroyer of Kecapati, śrī-Vīrappiratāpa śrī-Vīra Kiṣṇatēvamahārāyar is ruling at Vicayanakara.
In the course of his campaign to conquer the eastern direction, he took the fort of Utaiyakiri and captured Irāuttarāya mahāpattira ;
he capture at one bound Attaṅki, Vinikoṇṭai, Velaṅkoṇṭai, Nākāccuṉiturkkam, Taṅkeṭak Kētavaram and other mountain forts ;
he captured the fort of Koṇṭavīṭu after attacking it and

he captured alive the pāttira cāmantās like Piṟatāparuttiraṉ Kecapatirāyaṉ's son Kumāra-Vīrapattirarāyaṉ, Narakahatēvaṉ, the son of Kumāra-Ahammīrapāttiraṉ, Mallukāṉaṉkhān of Rāccūr, Uttaṇṭakāṉaṉkhān, Kacavāpāttira of Caṉṉiyāla, Pūcalappāṭi Rācirācu, Śrīnātarācu and Ilakṣmipatirācu and Paccima Vālacantira mahāpāttiram, and gave them the hand of protection.
Then he visited Taraṇikōṭṭam where he performed the tulāpuruşa-mahātāṉam gift of things equal in weight of a donor in the temple of Amarēcura.

Again he started for the conquest of Kaḷiṅkatēcam when he visited Pacavāṭai, took the fort of Koṇṭapaḷḷi, where he captured alive several pāṭṭiras like Piṟakarāca Ciṟaccantira mahāpāttiran mahāpāttira, and Pijilikāṉaṉ and gave them the hand of protection.
Then he captured Aṉantakiri, Uṇṭṟakoṇṭa, Uruḷakkoṇṭa, Aruvappaḷḷi, Callippaḷḷi, Attikkoṇṭa, Kappaluvāyi Nallaṅkoṇṭa Kaṉakakiri, Caṅkarakiri and tiṟamalli.
He, then visited Ciṅkāttiri, and Poṭṭuṉūr where he erected a victory pillar and from Ciṁhātti he returned and visited Irācamayēntiṟāvaram.
There his queens Ciṇṇācci Ammaṉ Tirumalaitēvi Ammaṉ performed mahātānam.

Hail! Prosperity! In the expried victorious and wonderful Cālivākaṉa Caka year 1438, in the year Tātu, on Monday the 13th day of the bright fortnight of the month of MakaraJanuary 5, 1517., the king i.e., Kṛṣṇatēvamahārāyar visited Śrī-Kaḷasti, worshipped the god Kāḷattināta, and provided for the god a 100-pillared maṇṭapam and the big kōpura.
Translated here for DHARMA (ERC n° 809994) by Renato Dávalos and and Emmanuel Francis (2024), based on .
